qas.question: Whose life was 'Schindler's List' based on?
How many Jews did Schindler save?
What did Spielberg first win Best Director for?
What did Spielberg do with 'Schindler's List' profits?

answers.text: set up the Shoah Foundation, a non-profit organization that archives filmed testimony of Holocaust survivors

qas.question: Where did the American Film Institute rank 'Schindler's List' in 1997?
In what year was the Shoah Foundation set up?
What movie did the American Film Institute rank as #1 on their 10 Greatest American Films ever Made list in 2007?
What was the first Spielberg movie to win the Best Picture award?
How many Holocaust survivors have filmed testimony for the Shoah Foundation?

context: Spielberg's next film, <b6_0><b7_0>Schindler's List<b7_0/><b6_0/>, was based on the true story of <a0_0>Oskar Schindler<a0_0/>, a man who risked his life to save <a1_0><b8_0>1,100<b8_0/><a1_0/> Jews from the Holocaust. <a2_0>Schindler's List<a2_0/> earned Spielberg his first Academy Award for Best Director (it also won Best Picture). With the film a huge success at the box office, Spielberg used the profits to <a3_0>set up the Shoah Foundation, a non-profit organization that archives filmed testimony of Holocaust survivors<a3_0/>. In <b5_0>1997<b5_0/>, the American Film Institute listed it among the 10 Greatest American Films ever Made (<a4_0>#9<a4_0/>) which moved up to (#8) when the list was remade in 2007.
